channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: I've hoped that even though Elon Musk was a partner of Peter Thiel in Paypal, that he didn't have the same disgusting nazi-like politics as Thiel. Give him the benefit of the doubt. Hope for the best. But it's becoming harder to give him that benefit.

1/4 Software is easy to debug if you treat it like anything else.
2/4 If you have what you think is a bad light bulb, but when you put a new bulb in the socket it doesn't work, you'd conclude the problem was in the socket, not the bulb.
3/4 (Although it doesn't hurt to try a third bulb from a different pack if possible. Sometimes two bulbs are broken.)
4/4 Debugging a problem in software is usually just a series of those kinds of tests.
Jordan Peterson announces he is 'departing' Twitter. https://t.co/kqx3Y1VMvq
@VincentBrannon @McNuttMonica They do charge you. And the driver gave me a bad rating.
What happens when the government stops buying Covid-19 vaccines? https://t.co/leB8RFe3Io
I have a product, https://t.co/mvc62pUlkz, that needs to be marketed and managed properly. I think it should ultimately be sold to one of the large streaming services.
2012: ‚ÄúIf the Web is Small Pieces Loosely Joined, Web 2.0 is Small Pieces Trapped In A Silo.‚Äù https://t.co/VRxBaLu2Jf
I agree ‚Äî Guy does great podcast! üòÄ https://t.co/nyQdJLBqki
Think of Dan Q as ‚Äúweb3‚Äù ‚Äî https://t.co/O08bNB2jAx
Is @BearsvilTheater building an outdoor stage, for music, in Woodstock?
@TaylorLorenz I hope AWS comes out with Twitter-as-a-service.

@AdamSinger @josephskewes One more thing, I feel like Lloyd Bentsen at the debate with Dan Quayle, where he explained that he was no John Kennedy. I‚Äôd feel a lot better about their project if they didn‚Äôt try to hijack the name of the web, one of the most consequential inventions of the century.
@AdamSinger @josephskewes https://t.co/sSf32YDIHT
Zoom is worth less than it was before the pandemic. https://t.co/Jn37Pz8BuY
Sarah Sherman Is Making 'SNL' Punk Again. https://t.co/M1ljW5LfN9
Things Humans Do That Dogs Dislike. https://t.co/nzzl4AwoLB
@AdamSinger @josephskewes Please take me off the cc list. Thanks.
NBA news: Patrick Beverley has a LOT of opinions on Chris Paul. (Great stuff.) https://t.co/0eRrv3LKiX
"The CDC propagates delusional thinking that community levels are very low." https://t.co/MjE2FdWgaE
@paull_evan I keep saying the same thing. No one is listening.

The more you make a certain upstate NY congressperson famous for pissing off libs, the more popular you make her with her constituents. Sometimes it's better to just stifle. ;-) https://t.co/8UmRGlo6ot
@mneylon That's good. What registrar? I looked at your profile it wasn't obvious.

For domain registrars everywhere... A feature I'd kill for is a page with a list of all my domains in machine readable form, OPML ideally. How I'd use it: 1. I'd view the page, 2. save it locally and 3. read it into my outliner.
After that, let me submit a page in the same format, of the domains I want to transfer to your site, because this feature makes you king (or queen or non-binary) of the domain registrar world.
Make it easy for me to edit my list locally. Ohhh. I need this. https://t.co/9ojsOOL88l
@dangillmor By any objective measure they have gone. They're in fascist territory.

@AdamSinger @josephskewes they almost never do. i've been around as long as anyone, the apple ii, ibm pc, the web, all the services we use now, none of them were vaporware, ever. they all started gaining awareness when they were ready to use. the mac was the only exception i can think of.

@AdamSinger good way of putting it. i've been dealing with this since i first started shipping commercial software. there's always something wonderful that doesn't exist yet just over the horizon. makes the thing you're shipping now seem mundane. and the ceos of the bigcos always fall for it
@AdamSinger it's been weird watching zuck paddle as hard as he can out to an island that doesn't exist. he used to be a meat and potatoes guy. not an architecture astronaut.
